wikipedia_page.main: Philip Clemo is a British composer, musician, record producer, sound artist, filmmaker and visual artist, described by Propermusic.com as one of contemporary music's most innovative artists.

response: *Philip Clemo, composer, musician, record producer, sound artist

Receiving a First Prize for ondes Martenot at the Paris Conservatoire National Supérieur de Musique (with Jeanne Loriod) and a master's degree in Musicology at the University of Strasbourg, Bloch has performed over 2500 times and appeared on over eighty recordings. Notable collaborations (concerts or recordings) include Radiohead, John Cage, Daft Punk, Damon Albarn / Gorillaz, Philip Clemo, Marianne Faithfull, Tom Waits and Bob Wilson
* Philip Clemo, The Rooms (All Colours Arts, 2008)

Ysanne began her recording career in 1996 by recording and releasing her first studio album, under the moniker Mee. Even in this first work, she relies heavily on Extended technique while playing an acoustic violin made from aluminum alloy. In 1997 she began collaborating with Philip ClemoPhilip Clemo  and released the album Sound – Inhale the Colours with him. Later that year on 25 June, she played electric violin with Laurie Anderson at the Queen Elizabeth Hall as part of the South Bank Meltdown Festival.

In 1999 she recorded another album with Philip Clemo, Soundzero, which was not released until 2008.As stated in the Chain D.L.K. review The same year she participated to various neofolk compilations, notably The Pact ...Of the Gods (Fremdheit), Torture Garden – Bizarre & Eccentric (Torture Garden Records), and the split single with Death in June We Said Destroy as part of the band Fire + Ice. She also produced the music on the album Time Dragons, a spoken word album.
* Sound – Inhale the colours, 1997, credited to Mee and Philip Clemo (Mee Music)
* Soundzero, 2008, credited to Ysanne Spevack and Philip Clemo (Koch / Cadiz)
Later in the 1990s Duncan worked with various artists, including film-maker Philip Clemo, Marianne Velvart's band, and folk singer Judith Silver.
